name: Putrid Imp
text: Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn.\nThreshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.

name: Hidden Horror
text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
flavor: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

name: Faceless Butcher
text: When Faceless Butcher enters the battlefield, exile target creature other than Faceless Butcher.\nWhen Faceless Butcher leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Twisted Abomination
text: {B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.\nSwampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Crosis, the Purger
text: Flying\nWhenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

name: Avatar of Woe
text: If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to cast.\nFear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\n{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: Terastodon
text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

name: Verdant Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

name: Sphinx of the Steel Wind
text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green
flavor: No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"

name: Inkwell Leviathan
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)\nTrample\nShroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: "Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."\n—Esper fable

name: Blazing Archon
text: Flying\nCreatures can't attack you.
flavor: "Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."\n—Dravin, Gruul deserter

name: Cabal Therapy
text: Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.\nFlashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Duress
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."\n—Liliana Vess

name: Entomb
text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

name: Reanimate
text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

name: Animate Dead
text: Enchant creature card in a graveyard\nWhen Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.\nEnchanted creature gets -1/-0.

name: Exhume
text: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.
flavor: "Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."\n—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Sickening Dreams
text: As an additional cost to cast Sickening Dreams, discard X cards.\nSickening Dreams deals X damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: The Patriarch dreams of vile plague.

name: Zombie Infestation
text: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.

name: Buried Alive
text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

name: Last Rites
text: Discard any number of cards. Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a nonland card from it for each card discarded this way. That player discards those cards.

name: Diabolic Servitude
text: When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.\nWhen the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.\nWhen Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.

name: Dread Return
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.\nFlashback—Sacrifice three creatures. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor: Those who forget the horrors of the past are doomed to re-meet them.

name: Crystal Vein
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

name: Ebon Stronghold
text: Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.\n{T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

name: Polluted Mire
text: Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.\nCycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
